analyzed: don 'di bstan pa'i ched du 'di //
translated: For the sake of teaching this meaning,

original: rang gi tshig dang lhan cig bshad //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang lhan cig bshad //
translated: this is explained together with its own words.

original: gal te bstan bcos khas ma blangs na ci ltar de'i don la dpyod gal te bstan bcos med na chos can nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dpyod pa mi 'jug pa yin na de'i tshe bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas ma blangs na ci ltar de'i don la dpyod gal te bstan bcos med na chos can nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dpyod pa mi 'jug pa yin na de'i tshe bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes
translated: If you do not accept the treatise, then why do you analyze its meaning? If you say that analysis does not apply because if there were no treatise, there would be no subject, then at that time the treatise is the object of refutation, and not anything else.

original: bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig bshad do //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir lhan cig bshad do //
translated: To demonstrate this, we explain it together.

original: lhan cig bshad pa ma yin pa ni pha rol po dag bstan bcos rang gi tshig pas nus pa lhag par 'dod pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig bshad pa ma yin pa ni pha rol po dag bstan bcos rang gi tshig pas nus pa lhag par 'dod pa'i phyir de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not explained together, then the opponent would assert that the treatise itself is more powerful, and that would be the case.

original: des na 'di la dpe dag kyang //
analyzed: des na 'di la dpe dag kyang //
translated: Therefore, we also present examples

original: mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin //
translated: that are similar to this.

original: tshad ma rnams ni yod min na //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni yod min na //
translated: If valid cognitions do not exist,

original: bstan bcos tshig ni rung phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos tshig ni rung phyir ro //
translated: then the words of the treatise would not be tenable.

original: @174a * // de nyid kyi phyir mtshungs par bstan pa'i don du dpe 'dra bar bshad de /
analyzed: @174a * // de nyid kyi phyir mtshungs par bstan pa'i don du dpe 'dra bar bshad de /
translated: For that very reason, we explain the example to be similar in order to demonstrate the meaning of similarity.

original: tshad ma spong na bstan bcos dang tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma spong na bstan bcos dang tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you reject valid cognitions, then the treatise and its words would not be tenable.

original: tshad ma 'gog na bstan bcos kyang tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ci zhig khas len te /
analyzed: tshad ma 'gog na bstan bcos kyang tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ci zhig khas len te /
translated: If you refute valid cognition, then since the treatise would not be valid cognition, what would you accept?

original: des na phan tshun 'gal ba tsam nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩrang gi tshig 'gal ma gsal ba'i //
analyzed: des na phan tshun 'gal ba tsam nyid du 'gyur ro // rang gi tshig 'gal ma gsal ba'i //
translated: Therefore, it would be mere mutual contradiction.üîΩWe have merely indicated

original: lung la phyogs tsam bstan pa yin //
analyzed: lung la phyogs tsam bstan pa yin //
translated: the contradiction with scripture.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa na chos //
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa na chos //
translated: In that regard, it is said that in the future

original: bde ba mi sgrub ces bya yin //
analyzed: bde ba mi sgrub ces bya yin //
translated: one will not attain happiness.

original: gal te tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIf valid cognition does not exist, how could this be taught in the treatise?‚Äù

original: tshad ma'i chos can ni bstan bcos nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i chos can ni bstan bcos nyid las 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The subject of valid cognition is not taught in the treatise.

original: gal te tshad ma 'ga' yang med pa ma yin na chos can la sogs pa ga las 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma 'ga' yang med pa ma yin na chos can la sogs pa ga las 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If valid cognition does not exist at all, how could the subject and so on be established?

original: des na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this contradicts your own words.

original: ci ste 'ga' zhig grub par khas len na /
analyzed: ci ste 'ga' zhig grub par khas len na /
translated: But if you accept that something is established,

original: gang las de grub pa de nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang las de grub pa de nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: then that from which it is established would be valid cognition,

original: gzhal bya bsgrub pa ni tshad ma nyid las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya bsgrub pa ni tshad ma nyid las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the establishment of the object of comprehension is from valid cognition itself.

original: tshad ma med na ni /
analyzed: tshad ma med na ni /
translated: If there were no valid cognitions,

original: 'ga' yang shes pa med do zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang shes pa med do zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then there would be no knowledge of anything.

original: des na 'di bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not a case of contradiction with the treatise.

original: gal te bstan bcos khas ma blangs pas smra na 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas ma blangs pas smra na 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: If you say that you do not accept the treatise, then there is no fault, because it is a hypothetical argument.

original: bstan bcos khas blangs so zhes ci ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs so zhes ci ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How do you know that you accept the treatise?

original: 'di ni bden te de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la bsal ba'i dpe ma yin te phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te de nyid kyi phyir 'dir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la bsal ba'i dpe ma yin te phyogs tsam zhig bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is true, but for that very reason, this is not an example of a contradiction with the treatise, because it is merely a hypothetical position.

original: rnam 'grel byed pas bsal ba'i dpe bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel byed pas bsal ba'i dpe bshad pa ni /
translated: The author of the commentary explains the example of a contradiction:

original: ma 'ongs pa ni chos bde bsgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni chos bde bsgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The future does not establish the present.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i yul la ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos khas blangs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la bsal ba'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i yul la ni gdon mi za bar bstan bcos khas blangs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la bsal ba'i dpe yin no //
translated: Because the object must be accepted as a treatise in this way, this is an example of a contradiction with the treatise.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rang gi tshig bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rang gi tshig bzhin du phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, here they are mutually contradictory, just like one‚Äôs own words.

original: de lta na ni 'o na gang du chos can tshad mas grub pa der bstan bcos khas blangs pas gnod par byed pa nyid de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gang du chos can tshad mas grub pa der bstan bcos khas blangs pas gnod par byed pa nyid de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then wherever the subject is established by a valid cognition, it is undermined by the treatise, because it is a valid cognition.

original: bstan bcos la yang grub pa'i chos can la ni de khas blangs pa de'i dbang nyid kyis de'i gnod par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos la yang grub pa'i chos can la ni de khas blangs pa de'i dbang nyid kyis de'i gnod par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And if the subject is established in the treatise, then it is undermined by the power of accepting that.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de la brten min dngos po la //
analyzed: de la brten min dngos po la //
translated: If you say that the subject is not based on that,

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal brjod na yang //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal brjod na yang //
translated: and it is contradictory to the treatise,üîΩit is not undermined, because the two

original: gnod pa ma yin gnyis po dag / nus pa mtshungs phyir gegs byed 'gyur //
analyzed: gnod pa ma yin gnyis po dag / nus pa mtshungs phyir gegs byed 'gyur //
translated: are equally able to obstruct.

original: bstan bcos @174b dang rang gi tshig dag ni khas blangs pa thams cad tshad mas grub pa'i phyir khyad par gzhan ni gcig kyang med do //
analyzed: bstan bcos @174b dang rang gi tshig dag ni khas blangs pa thams cad tshad mas grub pa'i phyir khyad par gzhan ni gcig kyang med do //
translated: Because all the words of the treatise and one‚Äôs own words are established by valid cognition, there is not even one other exception.

original: des na gnyi ga yang stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir gegs nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gnyi ga yang stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir gegs nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, because both are equal in strength, they are obstructions.

original: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is an entity that is harmed and an entity that harms.

original: dper na rang gi tshig bzhin te //
analyzed: dper na rang gi tshig bzhin te //
translated: For example, it is like your own words.

original: de yang de tshe rang tshig dag / de dag gang la tshad ma yod //
analyzed: de yang de tshe rang tshig dag / de dag gang la tshad ma yod //
translated: And those words of yours are not valid,

original: de ni gzhan la gnod byed 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la gnod byed 'gyur //
translated: so how can you invalidate the inferences of others?

original: de lta min na rigs bral gyi //üîΩdam bca' nus pa mtshungs pa yis //üîΩdam bca' ci bzhin don can gyi //
analyzed: de lta min na rigs bral gyi // dam bca' nus pa mtshungs pa yis // dam bca' ci bzhin don can gyi //
translated: If you do not accept that,üîΩthen your thesis is similar to the thesis of the opponent,

original: rjes dpag la ni ci ltar gnod //
analyzed: rjes dpag la ni ci ltar gnod //
translated: and just as your thesis is meaningless,üîΩso too your inference is meaningless.

original: lung rnams tshad ma yin pa ni //
analyzed: lung rnams tshad ma yin pa ni //
translated: The validity of scriptures

original: sngar nyid rnam par bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: sngar nyid rnam par bzlog pa yin //
translated: has already been refuted.

original: de yi phyir na khas blangs nas //
analyzed: de yi phyir na khas blangs nas //
translated: Therefore, having accepted

original: dpyod pa dag la skyon 'di 'dod //
analyzed: dpyod pa dag la skyon 'di 'dod //
translated: that analysis, you should accept this fault.

original: ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //üîΩdes na gnod phyir rjes dpag la //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go // des na gnod phyir rjes dpag la //
translated: This is a verse of intermission.üîΩTherefore, although the opponent‚Äôs inference

original: khas blangs phyi rol 'gyur min yang //
analyzed: khas blangs phyi rol 'gyur min yang //
translated: is not invalidated,

original: yul gyi khyad par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par bstan pa yin //
translated: we have shown the difference in the objects

original: phyir na tha dad byas pa yin //
analyzed: phyir na tha dad byas pa yin //
translated: and so we have made a distinction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnod par byed par khas blangs pa'i phyir lung rjes su dpag pa las pha rol du 'gyur ba ma yin yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnod par byed par khas blangs pa'i phyir lung rjes su dpag pa las pha rol du 'gyur ba ma yin yang /
translated: Therefore, because it is accepted as a refutation, scripture is not a different means of valid cognition from inference.

original: yul gyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad par byas so //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par bstan pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad par byas so //
translated: But it is distinguished from inference in order to show the difference in the objects of the two means of valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni gnod par byed pa nyid yin la bstan bcos ni gegs byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni gnod par byed pa nyid yin la bstan bcos ni gegs byed pa nyid do //
translated: Inference is a refutation, and scripture is a hindrance.

original: gegs byed pa de yang khas blangs pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta min na thal ches pa'am //
analyzed: gegs byed pa de yang khas blangs pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // de lta min na thal ches pa'am //
translated: That hindrance is accepted, not otherwise.üîΩOtherwise, there would be an overextension,

original: logs shig byas pa don med 'gyur //
analyzed: logs shig byas pa don med 'gyur //
translated: or the distinction would be pointless.

original: rang gi tshig kyang tha dad pa //
analyzed: rang gi tshig kyang tha dad pa //
translated: One‚Äôs own words are also different,

original: tshig tsam brjod la gegs byed yin //
analyzed: tshig tsam brjod la gegs byed yin //
translated: merely verbal expressions are a hindrance.

original: gal te dgos pa med kyang rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos kyi tshig dag rjes su dpag pa las tha dad par byed pa yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te dgos pa med kyang rang gi tshig dang bstan bcos kyi tshig dag rjes su dpag pa las tha dad par byed pa yin na ni //
translated: If one distinguishes one‚Äôs own words and the words of the treatise from inference even though they are not necessary,

original: don med pa'i phyir smra ba po mi mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir smra ba po mi mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because they are pointless, the speaker would be unskillful.

original: 'o na ni rigs pa'i sgor rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal bdag ci ltar phan tshun tha dad par byas te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rigs pa'i sgor rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang 'gal bdag ci ltar phan tshun tha dad par byas te /
translated: Well then, how can you make a distinction between the two, since your words and assertions contradict the door of reasoning?

original: gal te ci ltar smra ba thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba lta bur khas blangs pa'i don brjod pa'i rang gi tshig gis gnod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te ci ltar smra ba thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba lta bur khas blangs pa'i don brjod pa'i rang gi tshig gis gnod pa'am /
translated: For example, it is like the assertion, ‚ÄúAll speech is false,‚Äù which is undermined by the meaning of the words themselves.

original: dper na 'ug pa la sgra rtag go zhes bsgrub pa lta bur sngar khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no zhes te /
analyzed: dper na 'ug pa la sgra rtag go zhes bsgrub pa lta bur sngar khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no zhes te /
translated: Or, for example, it is like the proof that ‚Äúsound is permanent,‚Äù which is undermined by prior assertions.

original: yul tha dad par med na ni so sor bstan pa don med do zhe na /
analyzed: yul tha dad par med na ni so sor bstan pa don med do zhe na /
translated: If there is no distinction between the two, then there is no point in distinguishing them.

original: bden te tha dad pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bden te tha dad pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is true, there is no distinction between them.

original: de lta mod kyi sngar gzhag ba'i phyis nyams par byed pa ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sngar gzhag ba'i phyis nyams par byed pa ni khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba yin la /
translated: However, when something is first posited and later undermined, that is a contradiction of assertions.

original: dag de nyid rang gi don nyams par byed pa ni /üîΩrang gi tshig @175a * //
analyzed: dag de nyid rang gi don nyams par byed pa ni / rang gi tshig @175a * //
translated: When something undermines its own point,

original: dang 'gal ba yin no //üîΩde yi bstan bcos tshad mar ni //
analyzed: dang 'gal ba yin no // de yi bstan bcos tshad mar ni //
translated: that is a contradiction of one‚Äôs own words.üîΩBecause you accept that his treatises are valid,

original: khas blangs phyir na dngos kun la //
analyzed: khas blangs phyir na dngos kun la //
translated: all thingsüîΩare undermined.

original: gnod byed ce na gal te de //
analyzed: gnod byed ce na gal te de //
translated: If you say that it is a harm-doer,üîΩ

original: min 'dod gnod byed yin nam ci //
analyzed: min 'dod gnod byed yin nam ci //
translated: If you say that it is the object that is the basis of the error, then is it not the object that is the basis of the non-error?üîΩIf you say that it is not, then why is it the basis of the error?üîΩIf you say that it is, then why is it not the basis of the non-error?

original: rang tshig 'gal na rang tshig dang // bstan bcos 'gal tha dad med 'gyur //
analyzed: rang tshig 'gal na rang tshig dang // bstan bcos 'gal tha dad med 'gyur //
translated: If you say that it is not the basis of the non-error, then it is not the basis of the error either, because there is no difference between the two.üîΩIf you say that it is the object that is the basis of the error, then is it not the object that is the basis of the non-error?

original: gal te de mi 'dod na ci gnod par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de mi 'dod na ci gnod par byed pa yin nam /
translated: If you say that it is not, then why is it the basis of the error?

original: gal te ma yin no zhe na /üîΩdes 'dod na yang gnod par byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ma yin no zhe na / des 'dod na yang gnod par byed par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you say that it is, then why is it not the basis of the non-error?üîΩIf you say that it is not the basis of the non-error, then it is not the basis of the error either, because there is no difference between the two.

original: 'dod pa tshad ma ma yin na ni tshad mar byed pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩsngar khas blangs pa phyis gzhan du byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa tshad ma ma yin na ni tshad mar byed pa nyid ma yin no // sngar khas blangs pa phyis gzhan du byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the object that is the basis of the error, then is it not the object that is the basis of the non-error?

original: byas na 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: byas na 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: If you say that it is not, then why is it the basis of the error?üîΩIf you say that it is, then why is it not the basis of the non-error?üîΩIf you say that it is not the basis of the non-error, then it is not the basis of the error either, because there is no difference between the two.

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid do zhe na /üîΩde lta na 'o na rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar khas blangs pas na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba dag tha dad par med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid do zhe na / de lta na 'o na rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar khas blangs pas na rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba dag tha dad par med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that it is the object that is the basis of the error, then is it not the object that is the basis of the non-error?üîΩIf you say that it is not, then why is it the basis of the error?üîΩIf you say that it is, then why is it not the basis of the non-error?üîΩIf you say that it is not the basis of the non-error, then it is not the basis of the error either, because there is no difference between the two.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la mi 'dra ba med do //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba la mi 'dra ba med do //
translated: If you say that it is the object that is the basis of the error, then is it not the object that is the basis of the non-error?üîΩIf you say that it is not, then why is it the basis of the error?üîΩIf you say that it is, then why is it not the basis of the non-error?

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pas na //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas byas pas na //
translated: If you say

original: 'di tshad nyid ni yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: 'di tshad nyid ni yongs su rdzogs //
translated: The measure of it is complete.

original: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas bstan bcos tshad mar byas na de ni rang gi tshig la yang ma tshang ba med par yod do des na rang gi tshig las bstan bcos khyad par med do //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas bstan bcos tshad mar byas na de ni rang gi tshig la yang ma tshang ba med par yod do des na rang gi tshig las bstan bcos khyad par med do //
translated: If a treatise is accepted as valid because of the desire of a person, then his own words would exist without deficiency. Therefore, there is no difference between a treatise and his own words.

original: ci ste bstan bcos ni rang gi don bsgrub pa'i phyir khas blangs pas na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste bstan bcos ni rang gi don bsgrub pa'i phyir khas blangs pas na tshad ma yin no //
translated: But if a treatise is accepted as valid because it is accepted for the purpose of establishing its own meaning,

original: rang gi tshig ni gzhan gyi don du yin te des ni de tsam yin te gzhan gyi don la ni 'bad pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi tshig ni gzhan gyi don du yin te des ni de tsam yin te gzhan gyi don la ni 'bad pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then his own words are for the purpose of others, and that is sufficient, because there is no great effort for the purpose of others.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te yongs su brtags yin na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te yongs su brtags yin na //
translated: If it is imagined,

original: de ni tshad ma gnod byed yin //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma gnod byed yin //
translated: it is invalidated by valid cognition.

original: gal te brtags par mi 'jug na //
analyzed: gal te brtags par mi 'jug na //
translated: If it is not engaged in imagination,

original: rang gi tshig las khyad par med //
analyzed: rang gi tshig las khyad par med //
translated: there is no difference from his own words.

original: gal te brtags nas khas blangs na //
analyzed: gal te brtags nas khas blangs na //
translated: If it is accepted after imagination,

original: de'i tshe don de tshad ma nyid kyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mas gnod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe don de tshad ma nyid kyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mas gnod pa nyid do //
translated: then at that time, because the meaning is established by valid cognition, it is invalidated by valid cognition.

original: ma brtags na ni de tshig tsam nyid yin pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bstan bcos dang khyad par med do //üîΩdes na grags pa don dag yang //
analyzed: ma brtags na ni de tshig tsam nyid yin pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba bstan bcos dang khyad par med do // des na grags pa don dag yang //
translated: If one does not examine, then it is mere words, and the contradiction of one's own words is no different from a treatise.üîΩTherefore, if one rejects a treatise,

original: bstan bcos dor na nyes pa med //
analyzed: bstan bcos dor na nyes pa med //
translated: there is no fault in the known and the meaningful.

original: lkog gyur ngag las bstan bcos ni //
analyzed: lkog gyur ngag las bstan bcos ni //
translated: If one does not accept a treatise from speech that is hidden,üîΩone does not engage in analysis.

original: mi 'dod dpyod pa nyid mi 'jug / tshad mas rab tu grub pa'i chos can la dpyod pa gegs med pa'i bstan bcos 'dor yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi 'dod dpyod pa nyid mi 'jug / tshad mas rab tu grub pa'i chos can la dpyod pa gegs med pa'i bstan bcos 'dor yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If one rejects a treatise that is established by valid cognition, there is no fault in analyzing the subject.

original: 'on kyang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba 'ga' zhig ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba 'ga' zhig ste /
translated: However, there is a contradiction with what is accepted.

original: khas blangs pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the contradiction with what is accepted.

original: 'di bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i yul bsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i yul bsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not a refutation of the object that contradicts the treatise.

original: bstan bcos las grub pa'i chos can la @175b ni bstan bcos dor na dpyod pa 'jug mi srid pa'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i yul bsal ba ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos las grub pa'i chos can la @175b ni bstan bcos dor na dpyod pa 'jug mi srid pa'i phyir bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i yul bsal ba ni de nyid yin no //
translated: If one rejects a treatise regarding a subject that is established by the treatise, it is impossible to engage in analysis, and that itself is the refutation of the object that contradicts the treatise.

original: bstan bcos mi 'dod na ni de la sems pa mi 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos mi 'dod na ni de la sems pa mi 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: If one does not accept the treatise, then thought does not engage with it at all.

original: de lta na bstan bcos la brten nas /
analyzed: de lta na bstan bcos la brten nas /
translated: Thus, the thesis is contradicted by the treatise.

original: chos can la so sor gzhag pa des na de gnod pa can yin no //
analyzed: chos can la so sor gzhag pa des na de gnod pa can yin no //
translated: Since the subject is posited on the basis of the treatise, the thesis is contradicted by the treatise.

original: gal te bstan bcos tshad ma can ma yin pas ji ltar so sor 'jog ce na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos tshad ma can ma yin pas ji ltar so sor 'jog ce na /
translated: If the treatise is not authoritative, how can it be posited?

original: tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted as authoritative.

original: de lta na ni rang gis khas blangs pa kho nas tshad mar byas pa chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la chos gzhan la yang de nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba tha dad pa medüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rang gis khas blangs pa kho nas tshad mar byas pa chos can rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin la chos gzhan la yang de nyid kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba dang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the subject is posited as authoritative by one‚Äôs own acceptance, and since the other property is also established by that, there is no difference between contradiction of one‚Äôs own words and contradiction of the treatise.

original: 'di la brtags pa phal cher ni //
analyzed: 'di la brtags pa phal cher ni //
translated: Most of the analyses here

original: 'gal ba brjod yin 'di lta ste //
analyzed: 'gal ba brjod yin 'di lta ste //
translated: are just statements of contradictions,üîΩsuch as that desire and so on are nonvirtuous

original: chags sogs chos min ca ba dang // khrus kyis chos min dag 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chags sogs chos min ca ba dang // khrus kyis chos min dag 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and that bathing is not purifying.

original: 'di skad du yang /
analyzed: 'di skad du yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: sems kyi nang na gnas pa'i skyon //
analyzed: sems kyi nang na gnas pa'i skyon //
translated: The faults that reside within the mind

original: 'jug dogs khrus kyis dag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jug dogs khrus kyis dag mi 'gyur //
translated: are not purified by bathing, fearing they will emerge.

original: de ni lan brgyar bkrus byas kyang //
analyzed: de ni lan brgyar bkrus byas kyang //
translated: Even if it is washed a hundred times,

original: chang bum bzhin du gtsang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chang bum bzhin du gtsang mi 'gyur //
translated: it will not become clean, like a beer-barrel.

original: zhes brjod pa dang / de bzhin du yang brjod pa ni //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa dang / de bzhin du yang brjod pa ni //
translated: And also, it is said:

original: rang gi sgo nas kun sha 'khyil //
analyzed: rang gi sgo nas kun sha 'khyil //
translated: From one‚Äôs own side, the flesh is heaped up,

original: bil ba can dang sngon po'i ri //
analyzed: bil ba can dang sngon po'i ri //
translated: with the Bilva tree and the mountain of blue

original: kan kha lo yi 'jug ngogs su //
analyzed: kan kha lo yi 'jug ngogs su //
translated: at the ford of KanakhalƒÅ.

original: khrus byas yang 'byung srid ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: khrus byas yang 'byung srid ma yin // zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Even if one bathes there, one will not be reborn.

original: gal te 'ga' yang gnod pa ma yin gyi 'gal ba tsam du zad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' yang gnod pa ma yin gyi 'gal ba tsam du zad pa yin na /
translated: If nothing is harmful, but there is only contradiction,

original: 'o na khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba de ci'i don du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba de ci'i don du yin zhe na /
translated: then why is there a contradiction with what is accepted?

original: mthong dang ma mthong ba dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong ba dag la //
translated: In regard to what is seen and not seen,

original: rigs pas grub dang rang tshig gis //
analyzed: rigs pas grub dang rang tshig gis //
translated: reasoning and one‚Äôs own words

original: gnod byed bstan bcos gang yin de //
analyzed: gnod byed bstan bcos gang yin de //
translated: harm the treatise that is accepted.

original: gzung bar bya phyir dpyod 'jug 'gyur //üîΩmthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag /
analyzed: gzung bar bya phyir dpyod 'jug 'gyur // mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag /
translated: Therefore, one engages in analysis in order to grasp it.üîΩA treatise that is not contradicted by valid knowledge and one‚Äôs own words

original: tshad ma dang rang gi tshig gis mi 'gal ba'i bstan bcos khas blangs par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma dang rang gi tshig gis mi 'gal ba'i bstan bcos khas blangs par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: in regard to what is seen and not seen should be accepted.

original: de lta ma yin par khas len na ni rtog pa sngon du byed pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par khas len na ni rtog pa sngon du byed pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would not be a case of the reason being stated first.

original: grags pas bsal ba yang phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: grags pas bsal ba yang phyogs ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that the reason is refuted by what is commonly recognized.

original: de la grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi rtags yin no //
analyzed: de la grags pa ni rang bzhin gyi rtags yin no //
translated: In that case, what is commonly recognized is a reason based on nature.

original: gal te yid ches pa'i tshig don med par mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te yid ches pa'i tshig don med par mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: If a statement by a trustworthy person does not occur without a reason,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that way.

original: der ni khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: der ni khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa yod pa yin gyi /
translated: In that case, there is a relation of acceptance,

original: tshad mas grub pa ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa ni ma yin pas /
translated: but it is not established by a valid cognition,

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dngos po nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dngos po nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: so it is not a reason based on effect.

original: de la gal te grags pa yang dngos po'i 'brel pa can yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te grags pa yang dngos po'i 'brel pa can yin na /
translated: In that case, if what is commonly recognized has a relation to the thing,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin @176a * //üîΩgyi gtan tshigs dngos nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin @176a * // gyi gtan tshigs dngos nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time it is a reason based on nature.

original: 'on te khas blangs pas byas pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te khas blangs pas byas pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If it is made by acceptance, then at that time,

original: tshig bzhin du khas blangs pa nyid pas de ci ltar 'di gnod byed gzhan yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshig bzhin du khas blangs pa nyid pas de ci ltar 'di gnod byed gzhan yin par 'gyur /
translated: like a statement, it is just an acceptance, so how could it be a refutation of this?

original: gal te 'di ni yid ches pas gnod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni yid ches pas gnod pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you say that this is a fault because of belief,

original: gang gi phyir khas blangs pa gnod byed dag skye bo rnams 'dir yid ches yin zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khas blangs pa gnod byed dag skye bo rnams 'dir yid ches yin zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then why do you say, ‚ÄúThe faults that are accepted are believed by people here‚Äù?

original: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grangs pas ma bsal ba //
analyzed: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grangs pas ma bsal ba //
translated: Direct perception, inference, and belief are not refuted by number.

original: zhes bya ba ni grags pa'i sgra re re dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grags pa'i sgra re re dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: This is connected with each of the well-known terms.

original: des na gnod pa ni rnam pa gsum kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na gnod pa ni rnam pa gsum kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there are only three types of faults.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yang //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dbye ba yang //
translated: The division of inference

original: gnod pa de ni rnam bzhir bshad //
analyzed: gnod pa de ni rnam bzhir bshad //
translated: is explained as four types of faults.

original: ces smos pa'i phyir dang / slob dpon gyis kyang gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis logs shig tu dper brjod pa'i rnam pa bzhir bstan pa gzhung ma tshugs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ces smos pa'i phyir dang / slob dpon gyis kyang gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis logs shig tu dper brjod pa'i rnam pa bzhir bstan pa gzhung ma tshugs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Because this is stated, and because the master [DignƒÅga] also taught four types of examples separately with the words ‚Äúbecause of not being shared‚Äù and so on, it would be illogical for the treatise to be incomplete.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang // 'gal yin snga ma rang nyid dang // yang na rang bzhin 'bras bu yi //üîΩngo bos thal 'gyur 'di byas so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang // 'gal yin snga ma rang nyid dang // yang na rang bzhin 'bras bu yi // ngo bos thal 'gyur 'di byas so //
translated: This reductio is contradictory to the whole world, or it is contradictory to the former, or it is contradictory to the nature of things, or it is contradictory to the nature of the effect.

original: 'jig rten thams cad ngo bos thal 'gyur 'di byas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad ngo bos thal 'gyur 'di byas so //
translated: This reductio is contradictory to the whole world.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi grags pas gnod pa ni grags pas gnod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi grags pas gnod pa ni grags pas gnod pa yin la /
translated: The contradiction to what is renowned in the world is contradiction by renown.

original: 'ba' zhig gi grags pas gnod pa ni cig shos so //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gi grags pas gnod pa ni cig shos so //
translated: The contradiction to what is renowned to only one is contradiction to what is renowned to one.

original: yang na 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo gnyis thal bas sgrub par byed pa ni gnyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo gnyis thal bas sgrub par byed pa ni gnyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or, this shows that there are two types of reductio: that which establishes the nature of the reason by the nature of the effect, and that which establishes the nature of the effect by the nature of the reason.üîΩThe point of this is to show that the proponent has two types of arguments: direct arguments and reductio arguments, and that there is no other type of argument than these two.

original: 'di ltar rgol bas ni dngos kyi sgrub byed dang / thal ba'i sgrub byed gnyis nyid bya ba yin gyi rgol ba'i tshig dag la yang rnam pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgol bas ni dngos kyi sgrub byed dang / thal ba'i sgrub byed gnyis nyid bya ba yin gyi rgol ba'i tshig dag la yang rnam pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du yin no //
translated: Or, the point of this is to show that the proponent has two types of arguments: direct arguments and reductio arguments, and that there is no other type of argument than these two.

original: yang na / gang phyir kun tshe tha snyad pas //
analyzed: yang na / gang phyir kun tshe tha snyad pas //
translated: Since it is renowned to all,

original: sgra don rjes su 'breng ba yi //
analyzed: sgra don rjes su 'breng ba yi //
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows.üîΩ

original: bstan bcos ma yin des de la //
analyzed: bstan bcos ma yin des de la //
translated: The treatise is not connected with the meaning of the words,üîΩbut the words are connected with the meaning of the treatise.

original: tha dad phyir 'dir logs su byas //
analyzed: tha dad phyir 'dir logs su byas //
translated: Therefore, the words are set forth separately from the meaning of the treatise.

original: dngos ma yin yang grags pa ni //
analyzed: dngos ma yin yang grags pa ni //
translated: Even though the words are not the actual treatise,

original: gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir logs shig tu byas so //üîΩgal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba'i phyir logs shig tu byas so // gal te bstan bcos dang rang gi tshig dag khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir //
translated: they are indispensable for understanding the treatise, and therefore they are set forth separately.üîΩIf there is not the slightest difference between the treatise and the words,

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: then if the words contradict the treatise, the words themselves would contradict themselves.

original: des na gzhan rtogs par byed pa /
analyzed: des na gzhan rtogs par byed pa /
translated: Therefore, the words are set forth separately from the treatise.

original: bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i chos can la rtsod pa byed pas ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos las rab tu grags pa'i chos can la rtsod pa byed pas ni /
translated: One who debates about the subject matter that is well known in the treatise

original: gdon mi za bar bstan bcos kyi tshig dang / rang gi tshig dag tshad mar khas blang @176b bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bstan bcos kyi tshig dang / rang gi tshig dag tshad mar khas blang @176b bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: must certainly accept the words of the treatise and his own words as valid.

original: de'i ltar na gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin zhe na de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i ltar na gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba ma yin pa yin zhe na de yang ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then it is certainly not acceptable.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is explained by the acceptance of others.

original: rgol ba gzhan dag ni rtsod pa sgrub pas na chos can gzhan la rtsod kyang bstan bcos gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes khas len te ;
analyzed: rgol ba gzhan dag ni rtsod pa sgrub pas na chos can gzhan la rtsod kyang bstan bcos gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes khas len te ;
translated: Other opponents assert that since the treatise is established by argument, it is a subject of debate, but it must be accepted without doubt.

original: des na gdon mi za bar bstan bcos khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar bstan bcos khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that it is not to be accepted without doubt, this is stated.

original: yang na grags pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: yang na grags pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'i yul can yin la /
translated: Or else, what is renowned is the subject of what is desired to be said,

original: bstan bcos ni don dam pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir so sor nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: bstan bcos ni don dam pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir so sor nye bar bkod do //
translated: and the treatise is the subject of the ultimate, and therefore they are presented separately.

original: de la ma yang yin la mo gsham yang yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don gnod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir / yul ni spyi dang cig shos kyis //
analyzed: de la ma yang yin la mo gsham yang yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don gnod pa ni ma yin no // de'i phyir / yul ni spyi dang cig shos kyis //
translated: In that regard, it is not contradictory to say that she is a mother and also a barren woman.üîΩTherefore:üîΩThe object is asserted to be different

original: tha dad par ni brjod 'dod pa //
analyzed: tha dad par ni brjod 'dod pa //
translated: through the general and the other.

original: bstan bcos grags pas gnod pa yi //
analyzed: bstan bcos grags pas gnod pa yi //
translated: Since the treatise is renowned,

original: rnam dbye yin phyir tha dad nyid //
analyzed: rnam dbye yin phyir tha dad nyid //
translated: it is different because it is distinguished.

original: zhar la 'phros pa song zin te //
analyzed: zhar la 'phros pa song zin te //
translated: The digression is finished.

original: skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs nyid la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should enter into the occasion of the refutation of the object of refutation.

original: grags pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: grags pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this so-called ‚Äúworld‚Äù?

original: re zhig gal te khyab pa dang nyi tshe ba'i 'jig rten gyi grags pa mtha' dag gzung nas ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: re zhig gal te khyab pa dang nyi tshe ba'i 'jig rten gyi grags pa mtha' dag gzung nas ni de'i tshe /
translated: If you take the entire world, both the universal and the limited, then

original: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang 'jig rten mtha' dag la grags pa yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yang 'jig rten mtha' dag la grags pa yin te /
translated: eternality and so forth are also known to the entire world.

original: des na tshad mas bkag pa na yang 'jig rten gyi grags pas gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na tshad mas bkag pa na yang 'jig rten gyi grags pas gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, when they are refuted by valid cognition, they are refuted by what is known in the world.

original: tshad ma dang 'gal ba gzhan dag la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'gal ba gzhan dag la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the same would be true of other things that contradict valid cognition.

original: grags pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grags pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i don gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other object that is expressed by the term ‚Äúknown in the world.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du mi mgo'i thod pa mi gtsang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi mgo'i thod pa mi gtsang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The same would be true of such statements as ‚ÄúThe human skull is impure.‚Äù

original: 'on te bstan bcos las brjod pa gnod par mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bstan bcos las brjod pa gnod par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: But it is not right to refute what is stated in the treatises.

original: de lta yin na rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa gnod na yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa gnod na yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then it would be wrong to refute such things as the self and permanence.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: In response to this, we say the following.

original: 'dod pa'i sgra yi brjod bya ba //üîΩg-yo med gang yin grags pa yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra yi brjod bya ba // g-yo med gang yin grags pa yin //
translated: The object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚ÄùüîΩis fame, which is not fickle.

original: grags pa nyid ni tha snyad de //
analyzed: grags pa nyid ni tha snyad de //
translated: Fame is convention,

original: des bskyed phyir na de skad brjod /üîΩkhyad par 'phags par 'grub pa ni rab tu grags pa yin pas na /
analyzed: des bskyed phyir na de skad brjod / khyad par 'phags par 'grub pa ni rab tu grags pa yin pas na /
translated: because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.

original: des bskyed par 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid g-yo ba med pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: des bskyed par 'dod pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid g-yo ba med pa'i phyir khyad par du 'phags pa grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.

original: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni g-yo ba nyid do //üîΩbstan bcos kyis ni de 'gyur ba med par bya nus pa ma yin te tshad mas grub pa bstan bcos kyis bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni g-yo ba nyid do // bstan bcos kyis ni de 'gyur ba med par bya nus pa ma yin te tshad mas grub pa bstan bcos kyis bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.

original: tshad mas gnod pa @177a * //üîΩnyid kyis na //üîΩtshad nyid yin par bzlog phyir ro //üîΩ'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni de ltar g-yo ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa @177a * // nyid kyis na // tshad nyid yin par bzlog phyir ro // 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni de ltar g-yo ba ma yin te /
translated: The object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.

original: gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù is fame, which is not fickle, because it is produced by that.üîΩThe

original: de ltar yang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown.

original: don la 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa 'gog pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don la 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa 'gog pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The inference which refutes the fact that the meaning of a word is related to the mere desire of a person is not applicable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: don la skyes bu'i 'dod pa dang // rjes 'brel 'dod sgra'i brjod bya nyid //
analyzed: don la skyes bu'i 'dod pa dang // rjes 'brel 'dod sgra'i brjod bya nyid //
translated: The meaning is related to the desire of a person, and the meaning of a word is related to the desire.

original: bkag med phyir na gnod med dag / skye bo rnams 'dod yid ches yin //
analyzed: bkag med phyir na gnod med dag / skye bo rnams 'dod yid ches yin //
translated: Since this is not refuted, it is not impaired. The people believe it as they desire.

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa spyi'i rang bzhin du brtags pa 'dod pa'i sgras brjod bar bya ba ni dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa spyi'i rang bzhin du brtags pa 'dod pa'i sgras brjod bar bya ba ni dgag par mi nus so //
translated: The meaning of a word which is imagined as the universal of a cow, etc. cannot be refuted.

original: brtags pa'i don gyis mgu ba 'dod pa tsam gyis brtags pa ni dgag par nus pa ma yin na rig pa ni dgag par mi nus te /
analyzed: brtags pa'i don gyis mgu ba 'dod pa tsam gyis brtags pa ni dgag par nus pa ma yin na rig pa ni dgag par mi nus te /
translated: The imagination of a meaning which is imagined by the mere desire of a person who is satisfied with an imagined meaning cannot be refuted. But the knowledge cannot be refuted.

original: de bzhin du 'di yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di yang ngo //
translated: It is the same here.

original: gal te tshad mas grub pa'i dngos po nyid gnod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad mas grub pa'i dngos po nyid gnod par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the very thing which is established by a valid cognition is not impaired,

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rang rig pa nyid tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid tshad ma yin la /
translated: Self-awareness itself is the valid cognition.

original: sgra'i nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa brjod par bya ba nyid ni des grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i nye bar len pa dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa brjod par bya ba nyid ni des grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of expression is established by that, as the object that is the result of the appropriation of sound.

original: gal te de lta na brjod bya nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na brjod bya nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the object of expression is established by perception alone.

original: des na mngon sum gyis gsal ba'i phyogs nyid do //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis gsal ba'i phyogs nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is the position that is clarified by perception.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa yin gyi brjod bya rjod byed kyi dngos po gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa yin gyi brjod bya rjod byed kyi dngos po gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The state of being cause and effect is established by perception, but the state of being the object of expression and the means of expression is not another thing.

original: ma yin te brjod bya rjod byed kyi ngo bo de tsam yin pas /
analyzed: ma yin te brjod bya rjod byed kyi ngo bo de tsam yin pas /
translated: No, because the mere nature of the object of expression and the means of expression is that.

original: de ci ltar na gzhan du khas len zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na gzhan du khas len zhe na /
translated: How could it be accepted as something else?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: brjod bya nyid 'dir 'byung ba dang // byung gyur par gnas gsal ba dag khyab pa'i spyi yin des na //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid 'dir 'byung ba dang // byung gyur par gnas gsal ba dag khyab pa'i spyi yin des na //
translated: The object of expression that occurs here, that has occurred, and that abides are the pervasive universals.

original: mngon sum gyis ni gal rtogs //üîΩ'on kyang thog med bag chags las //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni gal rtogs // 'on kyang thog med bag chags las //
translated: By that, if the cause is realized by perception,üîΩnevertheless,

original: byung ba de lta'i tha snyad ni //
analyzed: byung ba de lta'i tha snyad ni //
translated: the convention that arises from beginningless latent tendenciesüîΩis not realized by perception.

original: yod phyir de ni yod do zhes //
analyzed: yod phyir de ni yod do zhes //
translated: Because it exists, it is said to exist.üîΩ

original: bya bar rtogs pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: bya bar rtogs pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIt exists‚Äù is the mere understanding of the expression.

original: de ltar yang de yang tha snyad brten pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang de yang tha snyad brten pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And this is explained as ‚Äúthe designation of a universal based on the particular.‚Äù

original: gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi ni sgra'i brjod byar 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi ni sgra'i brjod byar 'dod la /
translated: The universal defined as the exclusion of other is accepted as the referent of a word.

original: de yang dgag par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang dgag par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: And that cannot be refuted,

original: bag chags so sor nges pas na de lta bu'i rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags so sor nges pas na de lta bu'i rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of that sort arises due to the determination of the latent impressions.

original: bag chags de ni 'dod pa tsam gyis byas pa'i brda nges pas na spyi nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bag chags de ni 'dod pa tsam gyis byas pa'i brda nges pas na spyi nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that latent impression is the cause of the determination of the universal, because the word is applied by the mere wish to express it.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / bram ze la sogs gsal ba yis //üîΩgsal min nges pa 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bram ze la sogs gsal ba yis // gsal min nges pa 'dod pa yis //
translated: The brahmin and so on are not the referent of the word,üîΩbecause the word is applied to the particular,

original: brda 'jug can gyi sgra yis ni //
analyzed: brda 'jug can gyi sgra yis ni //
translated: and the word is applied to the particular,

original: de las gzhan @177b la bzlog phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan @177b la bzlog phyir ro //
translated: because it is the opposite of that which is not the referent.

original: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs kha dog dang dbyibs nges pa'i gsal bas gsal bar bya nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs kha dog dang dbyibs nges pa'i gsal bas gsal bar bya nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The particular of the brahmin and so on, which is determined by color and shape, is not able to be the referent of the word.

original: des na de dag ni gsal ba nges pa la brten pas nye bar mtshon pa /
analyzed: des na de dag ni gsal ba nges pa la brten pas nye bar mtshon pa /
translated: Therefore those are indicated as based on the determination of the particular.

original: gsal ba la nges pa'i brda'i stobs kyis gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba la nges pa'i brda'i stobs kyis gsal bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The power of the convention of certainty with regard to the manifest causes the manifestation.

original: gal te 'dir da ltar 'ga' zhig gis brdar byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dir da ltar 'ga' zhig gis brdar byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the convention is not made by someone here,

original: thog ma med pa nas grub pa'i brjod bya rjod byed kyi dngos po srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas grub pa'i brjod bya rjod byed kyi dngos po srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: because the entity of the expressed and the expresser is possible from beginningless time, that is not so,

original: bstan pa nyid brda yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa nyid brda yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the teaching itself is the convention.

original: gzhan yang bram ze dang bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bram ze dang bram ze ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúbrahmin‚Äù and ‚Äúnot a brahmin‚Äù are not the cause.

original: 'dir ni de'i rgyu mtshan mthong ba'i rgyu gang yin pa des bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de'i rgyu mtshan mthong ba'i rgyu gang yin pa des bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the cause of seeing the reason for that is to be established.

original: de lta ma yin na gdol pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang 'di la phan tshun rnam par dbye ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gdol pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang 'di la phan tshun rnam par dbye ba ci zhig yod /
translated: Otherwise, what is the difference between the castes of the candala and so on and this?

original: 'dis ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kyang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kyang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the castes of the cow and so on.

original: de dag kyang bong bu la sogs pa'i rigs dag las khyad par med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang bong bu la sogs pa'i rigs dag las khyad par med do //
translated: And those are not distinguished from the castes of the donkey and so on.

original: nye bar mtshon nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because they engage by way of illustration,üîΩthat is not so.

original: 'di la zho dag la sogs par nus pa tsam zhig dngos pa yin /
analyzed: 'di la zho dag la sogs par nus pa tsam zhig dngos pa yin /
translated: In this case, the mere capacity for curd, etc. is the entity.

original: nges na nye bar mtshon nyid de //
analyzed: nges na nye bar mtshon nyid de //
translated: If so, it is just the illustration.

original: mi tsam 'brel par mi 'gyur min //
analyzed: mi tsam 'brel par mi 'gyur min //
translated: It is not that the mere person is not related.

original: de bzhin du dbyangs la sogs pa'i rigs kyang de dang / sgra gcig gi yul gcig yin pa nyid kyis mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyangs la sogs pa'i rigs kyang de dang / sgra gcig gi yul gcig yin pa nyid kyis mtshon pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the class of vowels, etc. is also that, and the illustration is by the single object of a single sound.

original: des na rigs ni rnam par rigs pa'i yul nyid do //
analyzed: des na rigs ni rnam par rigs pa'i yul nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the class is the very object of the investigation.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / tha snyad las ni skyes pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir / tha snyad las ni skyes pa yi //
translated: the property is born from convention

original: chos te grags pa'i sgra yis brjod //
analyzed: chos te grags pa'i sgra yis brjod //
translated: and is expressed by a well-known term.

original: grags pa tsam la brda'i dngos po thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grags pa tsam la brda'i dngos po thob pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the basis of the sign is obtained by mere renown,

original: tha snyad las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad las skyes pa'o //
translated: it is born from convention.

original: chos de ni grags pa'i sgrar brjod do //üîΩchos 'dir 'ba' zhig grags pa yis //
analyzed: chos de ni grags pa'i sgrar brjod do // chos 'dir 'ba' zhig grags pa yis //
translated: That property is expressed by a well-known term.üîΩNot only is this property expressed by a well-known term,üîΩbut also

original: mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i sgrar brjod par ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang /üîΩmngon sum sogs kyis gzhal bya yang //
analyzed: mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'i sgrar brjod par ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang / mngon sum sogs kyis gzhal bya yang //
translated: the object of valid knowledge that establishes the definition is expressed by a term.üîΩMoreover,

original: 'jal byed sgra sgro btags nas brjod //
analyzed: 'jal byed sgra sgro btags nas brjod //
translated: the object of comprehension by direct perception, etc. is also expressed by superimposing the term that comprehends it.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa la yang gzhal ba'i don nyid phyogs ltar snang ba zhes bya ba don gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa la yang gzhal ba'i don nyid phyogs ltar snang ba zhes bya ba don gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Even in the case of perception, etc., the object of cognition is invalidated by another object which appears to be similar to it.

original: de'i 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya ba lang la sogs pa ni dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod bya ba lang la sogs pa ni dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the object of the word, such as a cow, etc., which is desired by him, cannot be denied.

original: / de nyid kyis gog pa la gnod pa yin no //üîΩtha snyad kyi don d sbyar ba'i sgras nye bar bkod pa'i rig byed las byung ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul thams cad dang 'gal ba med pa can ni /
analyzed: / de nyid kyis gog pa la gnod pa yin no // tha snyad kyi don d sbyar ba'i sgras nye bar bkod pa'i rig byed las byung ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul thams cad dang 'gal ba med pa can ni /
translated: That very thing is the invalidation of the opponent.

original: smyon pa ma yin pas dgag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: smyon pa ma yin pas dgag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The one who is not insane cannot deny all the objects of convention, such as the Vedic injunctions, etc., which are set forth by words that are applied to the objects of convention, and which are not in contradiction with anything.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: That very thing is explained:

original: de la brten nas 'byung ba can //üîΩ'dod @178a * //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'byung ba can // 'dod @178a * //
translated: It arises in dependence on that.

original: pas 'jug phyir bkag med pa //
analyzed: pas 'jug phyir bkag med pa //
translated: Because it engages through desire, it is not denied.

original: byas pa 'am ma byas pa rnams kyi //
analyzed: byas pa 'am ma byas pa rnams kyi //
translated: Whether it is created or not created,

original: sna tshogs rang bzhin nyid kyis rung //
analyzed: sna tshogs rang bzhin nyid kyis rung //
translated: it is suitable by its very nature.

original: thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis de la brten nas 'byung ba can tha snyad las skyes pa lnga nyid la sogs pa byas pa dang ma byas pa rnams kyi rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis de la brten nas 'byung ba can tha snyad las skyes pa lnga nyid la sogs pa byas pa dang ma byas pa rnams kyi rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: All are suitable for the five that arise from conventional expressions, such as the produced and the unproduced, which arise in dependence on that nature.

original: rang nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnams ni thams cad la rung ba yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnams ni thams cad la rung ba yin te /
translated: Those that arise by themselves are suitable for all,

original: thams cad la mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no incompatibility with any.üîΩIncompatibility itself is suitability.

original: mi mthun pa med pa nyid rung ba yin no des na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa nyid rung ba yin no des na /
translated: Therefore,üîΩthe suitability of sound

original: don tsam dang ni rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: don tsam dang ni rjes 'brel can //
translated: is related to mere objects,

original: 'byung ba 'am ni 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'am ni 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: whether they arise or will arise.

original: sgra yi rung ba nyid de yis //
analyzed: sgra yi rung ba nyid de yis //
translated: By that suitability of sound,

original: mi mthun pa dag gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dag gnod par 'gyur //
translated: incompatibilities are negated.

original: sgra rnams kyi byung ba'am 'byung ba'i sgra'i rung ba nyid ni 'gog pas bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi byung ba'am 'byung ba'i sgra'i rung ba nyid ni 'gog pas bzlog par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The suitability of sound that arises or will arise cannot be negated by refutation,

original: mtho ris 'dod pas me'i sbyin sreg gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni khyi sha za ba la sogs pa la dgag par mi nus te /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas me'i sbyin sreg gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni khyi sha za ba la sogs pa la dgag par mi nus te /
translated: just as eating dog meat and so on cannot be negated by the statement ‚ÄúFor the sake of heaven, perform fire sacrifice.‚Äù

original: don tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is related to the mere object.

original: don der yang mi mthun pa med pas rung ba nyid do //üîΩbrda byed pa la mi mthun pa'i don ni 'ga' yang mthong ba 'am /
analyzed: don der yang mi mthun pa med pas rung ba nyid do // brda byed pa la mi mthun pa'i don ni 'ga' yang mthong ba 'am /
translated: And the object is not incompatible, so it is suitable.

original: bstan pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: When a sign is made, the object is not incompatible, and it is not understood by seeing or by being shown.

original: tsam gyi sgra ni khyad par med par gzung ba'i don te /üîΩdper na bram ze tsam la zan sbyin no //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgra ni khyad par med par gzung ba'i don te / dper na bram ze tsam la zan sbyin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù means the object is apprehended without distinction.

original: zan tsam sbyin par 'dod do zhes bya ba khyad par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zan tsam sbyin par 'dod do zhes bya ba khyad par yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúI will give food to the brahmins‚Äù or ‚ÄúI want to give mere food.‚ÄùüîΩIt is not that a distinction is being made.

original: rung ba tsam don dang rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa de la ni 'gog pa 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba tsam don dang rjes su 'brel pa gang yin pa de la ni 'gog pa 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable to deny anything that is related to the mere object.

original: des na 'gog pa rung ba nyid des gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gog pa rung ba nyid des gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the denial is invalidated by the suitability.

original: rung ba nyid dgag pa ni mngon sum gyis bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rung ba nyid dgag pa ni mngon sum gyis bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: The denial of suitability is not established by perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid 'jug par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid 'jug par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If it is argued that it is established by inference,

original: de yang dpe med pa'i phyir srid pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te slob dpon gyis sgra las byung ba'i grags pas zhes gsungs kyi rung ba nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: de yang dpe med pa'i phyir srid pa ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro // gal te slob dpon gyis sgra las byung ba'i grags pas zhes gsungs kyi rung ba nyid kyis ni /
translated: and since there is no example of this, it is not possible.

original: gnod par ma gsungs ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnod par ma gsungs ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the master [Vasubandhu] says ‚Äúfrom what is commonly recognized in the world,‚Äù does he not say that it is not contradicted by what is correct?

original: 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni rung ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid ni rung ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The object of expression of a desired sound is not what is correct.

original: de lta bu'i grags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i grags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not commonly recognized in that way.

original: rung ba nyid ni grags pa'i sgra'i rgyu yin gyi grags pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni grags pa'i sgra'i rgyu yin gyi grags pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Correctness is the cause of a sound that is commonly recognized, but it is not itself commonly recognized.

original: 'di la bshad pa ;üîΩgrags pa med kyang dngos po la //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ; grags pa med kyang dngos po la //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows:üîΩEven without being commonly recognized,

original: rung nyid de yi stobs nyid las //
analyzed: rung nyid de yi stobs nyid las //
translated: correctness is due to the power of things.

original: de las sgra kun 'brel des na //
analyzed: de las sgra kun 'brel des na //
translated: From that, all sounds are connected,

original: de la de ni grub pa yin //
analyzed: de la de ni grub pa yin //
translated: and that is established in that.

original: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa yang 'di ste sgra las byung ba'i grags pa smos pas ni rung ba nyid bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi dgongs pa yang 'di ste sgra las byung ba'i grags pa smos pas ni rung ba nyid bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The master‚Äôs intention is this: By mentioning what is commonly recognized in the world, correctness is taught,

original: grub zin pa'i brjod bya nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grub zin pa'i brjod bya nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the object of expression that is already established.

original: rung ba nyid ni 'dod pa @178b tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni 'dod pa @178b tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Appropriateness is the mere desire and the connection with it.

original: de yang brda la mi mthun pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang brda la mi mthun pa med pa nyid do //
translated: And that is the absence of disagreement about the sign.

original: sgra ni dngos po thams cad la //
analyzed: sgra ni dngos po thams cad la //
translated: The sound is applied to all things

original: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa yin //
translated: by mere desire.

original: de tsam gyis 'jug sgra gang de //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'jug sgra gang de //
translated: What sound is applied by mere desire,

original: ci ltar 'gar yang bzlog par nus //üîΩdngos rnams ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: ci ltar 'gar yang bzlog par nus // dngos rnams ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: how can it be stopped anywhere?üîΩThings do not have an essence

original: rjod byed 'jug par byed ma yin //
analyzed: rjod byed 'jug par byed ma yin //
translated: that causes the application of the name.

original: brda las mi mthun med pa ni //
analyzed: brda las mi mthun med pa ni //
translated: The absence of disagreement about the sign

original: rung ba nyid ces bya bar brjod //
analyzed: rung ba nyid ces bya bar brjod //
translated: is called ‚Äúappropriateness.

original: 'dod pa tsam gyis sprul pa gang //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam gyis sprul pa gang //
translated: ‚Äù What is emanated by mere desire

original: de ni don tsam rjes 'brel nyid //
analyzed: de ni don tsam rjes 'brel nyid //
translated: is connected with mere meaning.

original: don tsam la yang ltos med na //
analyzed: don tsam la yang ltos med na //
translated: If it did not depend on mere meaning,

original: brda 'dod par ni ci ltar 'gyur //üîΩphyogs 'dis gang tshe bum pa la //
analyzed: brda 'dod par ni ci ltar 'gyur // phyogs 'dis gang tshe bum pa la //
translated: how could there be a desire for the sign?üîΩBy this method, when the word ‚Äúmoon‚Äù

original: zla ba'i sgra yi brjod bya nyid //üîΩ'gog pa der ni grags pa yi ;
analyzed: zla ba'i sgra yi brjod bya nyid // 'gog pa der ni grags pa yi ;
translated: is the referent of the word ‚Äúvase,‚ÄùüîΩthe refutation of that is the harm

original: / gnod pa yin zhes mngon par 'dod //
analyzed: / gnod pa yin zhes mngon par 'dod //
translated: to what is renowned, as is well known.

original: ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //
translated: These are the verses in the middle.

original: gal te mi mthun pa med pa'i rung ba nyid ji ltar 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa med pa'i rung ba nyid ji ltar 'byung ba 'am /
translated: If it is asked how the suitable one who is free from discord arises,üîΩ

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is the suitability of the absence of incompatibility established or will it be established?üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'di ltar brjod pa /üîΩdon ni 'byung dang 'byung 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod pa / don ni 'byung dang 'byung 'gyur phyir //
translated: we respond:üîΩBecause the object is suitable to be expressed and to arise,

original: rung ba nyid kyis de lta nyid //
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyis de lta nyid //
translated: it is suitable to be expressed.

original: ngo bo nyid las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from its own nature,

original: rung nyid ces bya rtogs pa med //
analyzed: rung nyid ces bya rtogs pa med //
translated: there is no such thing as ‚Äúsuitability.‚Äù

original: de la don gang zhig sgra gang gis brjod par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa de ni sgra des brjod par rung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la don gang zhig sgra gang gis brjod par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa de ni sgra des brjod par rung ba yin te /
translated: In this regard, the object that is asserted to be the referent of a term is suitable to be expressed by that term.

original: dper na shing gi sgras brjod par rung ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shing gi sgras brjod par rung ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, a tree is suitable to be expressed by the term ‚Äútree.‚Äù

original: 'ga' yang gang du yang mi mthun pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang du yang mi mthun pa ni med do //
translated: There is no incompatibility whatsoever.

original: gal te dpe nyid ma grub ste //
analyzed: gal te dpe nyid ma grub ste //
translated: If you say that the example is not established

original: de yang spang ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang spang ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is possible to reject it,

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩsu zhig brjod bya rjod byed kyi //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / su zhig brjod bya rjod byed kyi //
translated: that is not so.üîΩWho would reject the conventional usage

original: dngos po tha snyad zhugs pa spong //
analyzed: dngos po tha snyad zhugs pa spong //
translated: of the referent and the term?

original: des na 'jug pas don de ni //
analyzed: des na 'jug pas don de ni //
translated: Therefore, because of usage,

original: rtogs par mthong ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par mthong ba nyid yin no //
translated: we see that the referent is understood.

original: brjod bya rjod byed kyi dngos po ni //
analyzed: brjod bya rjod byed kyi dngos po ni //
translated: The entity that is the expressed and the expresser

original: 'di nyid du zad do //
analyzed: 'di nyid du zad do //
translated: is just this.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: sgra gang zhig ni brjod pa na //
analyzed: sgra gang zhig ni brjod pa na //
translated: When a word is uttered,

original: rtogs 'gyur don gang yin pa de //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur don gang yin pa de //
translated: the meaning that is understood

original: sgra yi don ni yin brjod de //
analyzed: sgra yi don ni yin brjod de //
translated: is said to be the meaning of the word.

original: don gyi mtshan nyid gzhan yod min //
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid gzhan yod min //
translated: There is no other definition of the meaning.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de lta na ni 'o na dam bca' ba'i don mngon sum gyis gnod pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dam bca' ba'i don mngon sum gyis gnod pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: If that is so, then the meaning of the thesis is undermined by perception itself,

original: grags pa'i gnod pas ci zhig bya zhen /
analyzed: grags pa'i gnod pas ci zhig bya zhen /
translated: so what is the point of undermining it by what is commonly acknowledged?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'di ci tsam zhig bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ci tsam zhig bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a proof of anything at all.

original: 'on kyang rigs pa 'dis yul lam dus 'ga' zhig la yang sgra thams cad brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs pa 'dis yul lam dus 'ga' zhig la yang sgra thams cad brjod par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: However, by this reasoning, all words are asserted to express their objects in some place or time.
