translated: If it is not refuted by direct perception, inference, scriptural authority, or common knowledge, it is a thesis.

original: dper na sgra ni mnyan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni mnyan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: For example, sound is not audible,

original: bum pa ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩgzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma dag med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang bcas pa tsam gyis 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: bum pa ni rtag pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o // gzhal bya'i don can gyi tshad ma dag med do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang bcas pa tsam gyis 'gal ba yin la /
translated: and a pot is permanent.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThere are no valid cognitions that perceive objects‚Äù contradicts the mere existence of valid cognitions.

original: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba'i don sgra las byung ba'i grags pas bsal ba de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bzhag ste lung bstan pas gnod pa'i rgyu dang bcas par
analyzed: gang la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba'i don sgra las byung ba'i grags pas bsal ba de yang phyogs ma yin no zhes mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bzhag ste lung bstan pas gnod pa'i rgyu dang bcas par
translated: It is also not the case that the opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by the force of scripture, as the opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by the force of direct perception and inference.

original: gsungs te / dam bcas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba dang / sgra las byung ba'i grags pas zhes bya bar ro //üîΩde lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs te / dam bcas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba dang / sgra las byung ba'i grags pas zhes bya bar ro // de lta ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by the force of scripture‚Äù is made in the context of the opponent‚Äôs position being refuted by the force of direct perception and inference.

original: gal te slob dpon yul tha dad par ston par bzhed pa ma yin na ni 'di gnyis rgyu dang bcas par gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te slob dpon yul tha dad par ston par bzhed pa ma yin na ni 'di gnyis rgyu dang bcas par gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the master did not intend to teach different topics, he would not have stated that the two are accompanied by a cause.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa smra ba mtha' dag gis gtso bo rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa smra ba mtha' dag gis gtso bo rigs pa'i dbang phyug dam pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the intention of the great lord of reasoning, the holy [DignƒÅga].

original: sbyor bar byed pa rnam par 'byed pa la thugs gcig tu gzhol zhing gsungs pa la mkhas pa ni dgos pa yongs su rgyas pa las gzhan gsung mi srid do //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa rnam par 'byed pa la thugs gcig tu gzhol zhing gsungs pa la mkhas pa ni dgos pa yongs su rgyas pa las gzhan gsung mi srid do //
translated: Those who are skilled in composition, who are intent on discerning the meaning, and who are skilled in speech, cannot possibly speak of anything other than the full development of the purpose.

original: 'di ltar / 'bigs byed nang nas mi bzad mun chen rgya chen 'joms pa'i thugs mnga' ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'bigs byed nang nas mi bzad mun chen rgya chen 'joms pa'i thugs mnga' ba //
translated: Thus, [the Buddha] possesses a mind that destroys the great, unbearable darkness from within the Vindhya mountains,

original: dge legs rigs mthor 'od zer tshogs chen rtag tu 'gyed par mdzad pa po //
analyzed: dge legs rigs mthor 'od zer tshogs chen rtag tu 'gyed par mdzad pa po //
translated: and always emits a great mass of light rays from the high family of virtue and goodness.

original: lam bral mi gshegs gzhan gyis thogs med slob dpon sngon med nyi ma yin /üîΩmu stegs gzhung gi lam zhugs mtshan mo rgyu ba'i tshogs @191a * //
analyzed: lam bral mi gshegs gzhan gyis thogs med slob dpon sngon med nyi ma yin / mu stegs gzhung gi lam zhugs mtshan mo rgyu ba'i tshogs @191a * //
translated: He is the sun that has never existed before, the master who does not travel on a path, but goes without obstruction.üîΩHe destroys the entire assembly of non-Buddhists who travel at night,

original: rnams thams cad bshig / de'i phyir yul tha dad pa nyid rigs so //
analyzed: rnams thams cad bshig / de'i phyir yul tha dad pa nyid rigs so //
translated: who have entered the path of the scriptures of the tƒ´rthikas. Therefore, it is reasonable that [the Buddha] has different [bodies] in different places.

original: lhag ma ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained before.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod 'di la yang /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod 'di la yang /
translated: [This is] also undermined by perception.

original: sgra ni du ma'i dngos nyid du //
analyzed: sgra ni du ma'i dngos nyid du //
translated: Sound is of the nature of many things.üîΩThe nature of what is renowned

original: grags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhig / sna tshogs su ni snang ba yi //
analyzed: grags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhig / sna tshogs su ni snang ba yi //
translated: is the arising of cognition that appears as various things.

original: blo ni skye ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo ni skye ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since it is not produced,

original: mnyan la gnyis med snang gyur pa //
analyzed: mnyan la gnyis med snang gyur pa //
translated: it appears as nondual to the hearer.

original: gal te rtogs pa'i phyir slong dpon gyis ma gsungs kyang /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'i phyir slong dpon gyis ma gsungs kyang /
translated: Even if the teacher did not say it because he understood it,

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa 'dir yang brjod par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa 'dir yang brjod par bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that it is not stated here because it is contradicted by perception.

original: der yang brjod par bya ba ni sgra mnyan par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der yang brjod par bya ba ni sgra mnyan par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: There, what is stated is that sound is to be heard, and this does not refute the relation.

original: 'o na ci zha na sna tshogs su snang ba'i blo skye ba med pa'i phyir nyan pa la gnyis su med par snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zha na sna tshogs su snang ba'i blo skye ba med pa'i phyir nyan pa la gnyis su med par snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'o //
translated: What then? It is the nature that appears as nondual to the hearer because the arising of cognition that appears as various things does not exist.

original: rigs dang 'brel pa la sogs pa ni sgra'i snang ba dang lhan cig spyod par snang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rigs dang 'brel pa la sogs pa ni sgra'i snang ba dang lhan cig spyod par snang ba ma yin la /
translated: The relation of the sound to the hearer and so on does not appear to be simultaneous with the appearance of the sound.

original: mi snang ba yang ci ltar mngon sum yin la mngon sum yin pa spangs pas kyang mngon sum gyis gnod par ci ltar 'gyur ;
analyzed: mi snang ba yang ci ltar mngon sum yin la mngon sum yin pa spangs pas kyang mngon sum gyis gnod par ci ltar 'gyur ;
translated: How can something that is not manifest be a direct perception? And how can a direct perception be invalidated by the rejection of something that is manifest?

original: 'di yang de bzhin du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained in the same way.

original: de'i phyir snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid spong na mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid spong na mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the nature of manifestation is rejected, the fault of being invalidated by direct perception will ensue.

original: de don don bshad 'di nyid ni //
analyzed: de don don bshad 'di nyid ni //
translated: This very meaning is explained:

original: spong na mngon sum gyis gnod 'gyur //
analyzed: spong na mngon sum gyis gnod 'gyur //
translated: If it is rejected, it will be invalidated by direct perception.

original: de'i don nyid du slob dpon gyis //
analyzed: de'i don nyid du slob dpon gyis //
translated: The Master has stated this very meaning:

original: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas ma bsal ba //
analyzed: mngon sum don dang rjes dpag dang // yid ches grags pas ma bsal ba //
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception, inference, and testimony are not refuted.‚Äù

original: zhes don smos so //
analyzed: zhes don smos so //
translated: He mentions the meaning.

original: rang bzhin de nyid don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that very nature is the meaning.

original: spyi la sogs pa ni don ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa ni don ma yin te /
translated: Universals, etc. are not the meaning,

original: mngon sum la snang ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la snang ba'i nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the capacity to appear to direct perception.

original: gang la de yang mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la de yang mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: And that is not direct perception.

original: de spong ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de spong ba ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: The rejection of that is not invalidation by direct perception.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni ;
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni ;
translated: This is explained:

original: ngo bo de nyid de la don //
analyzed: ngo bo de nyid de la don //
translated: The essence itself is the object.

original: lhag ma ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: lhag ma ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: The rest have the characteristic of exclusion.

original: spyi ni dngos med ngo bo yin //
analyzed: spyi ni dngos med ngo bo yin //
translated: The universal is the essence of a non-entity.

original: de phyir de dbang spyod yul min //üîΩdes ni spyi yi chos rnams ni //
analyzed: de phyir de dbang spyod yul min // des ni spyi yi chos rnams ni //
translated: Therefore, it is not the object of the senses.

original: mngon sum min par grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mngon sum min par grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Since it is established that universals are not perceived,

original: spong yang gnod pa yod min zhes //
analyzed: spong yang gnod pa yod min zhes //
translated: there is no fault in rejecting them.

original: mnyan bya smos pas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: mnyan bya smos pas bstan pa yin //
translated: This is stated by the word ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rang bzhin du gsal bar snang ba nyid don yin no //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rang bzhin du gsal bar snang ba nyid don yin no //
translated: The essence that appears clearly as present in front is the object.

original: spyi dang 'brel pa la sogs pa dag ni ldog pa las de lta bu'i rang bzhin du brtags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi dang 'brel pa la sogs pa dag ni ldog pa las de lta bu'i rang bzhin du brtags pa yin gyi /
translated: Universals and relations, etc., are imagined to have such an essence from the point of view of exclusion,

original: don gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin na ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin na ma yin te /
translated: but they are not the essence of the object.

original: rigs mi mthun dang mi 'dra ba nyid la mthong ba'i phyir dang / rang bzhin gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i spyi @191b gzhan mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun dang mi 'dra ba nyid la mthong ba'i phyir dang / rang bzhin gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i spyi @191b gzhan mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are seen to be unlike things of different types, and because no other universal that does not possess two natures is seen.

original: gal te / rigs mthun rnams kyang phan tshun du //
analyzed: gal te / rigs mthun rnams kyang phan tshun du //
translated: If you say that even things of the same type

original: mi 'dra zhes bya 'di dang ldan //
analyzed: mi 'dra zhes bya 'di dang ldan //
translated: are said to be different from each other,

original: des na ji ltar rigs mthun la //
analyzed: des na ji ltar rigs mthun la //
translated: Therefore, just as in the case of a cow,

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i tha snyad med //üîΩji ltar ba lang ba lang min //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i tha snyad med // ji ltar ba lang ba lang min //
translated: there is no convention of a non-cow.üîΩJust as a cow is seen to be

original: gzhan dag las ni ldog par mthong //
analyzed: gzhan dag las ni ldog par mthong //
translated: excluded from what is not a cow,

original: de bzhin rta dang ba lang dag ba rta rigs mthun gzhan dag las //
analyzed: de bzhin rta dang ba lang dag ba rta rigs mthun gzhan dag las //
translated: in the same way, a horse and a cow are excluded from other things of the same type, such as other horses and other cows.

original: des na log pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: des na log pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: Therefore, mere exclusion

original: 'chol pa med par 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'chol pa med par 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: is not established without confusion.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin can gyis ni //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin can gyis ni //
translated: Because it is based on the nature of things,

original: rnam par phye bar gnas pa'i phyir //üîΩde don gnyer ba'i tha snyad ni //
analyzed: rnam par phye bar gnas pa'i phyir // de don gnyer ba'i tha snyad ni //
translated: the distinction is maintained.üîΩThe convention of those who seek that

original: ma 'chol bar ni 'jug par byed //
analyzed: ma 'chol bar ni 'jug par byed //
translated: meaning operates without confusion.

original: rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa la /
translated: In the understanding of its own nature,

original: 'chol pa srid pa ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: 'chol pa srid pa ma yin no / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: confusion is not possible.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / gal te spyi sogs ngo bo yis //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te / 'di ltar / gal te spyi sogs ngo bo yis //
translated: That is not so, becauseüîΩif a universal and so on were understood

original: 'ba' zhig tshe na rtogs na ni //üîΩrang gi ngo bor rtogs pa la //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig tshe na rtogs na ni // rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa la //
translated: only when it is alone,

original: 'chol bar thal ba med pa nyid //
analyzed: 'chol bar thal ba med pa nyid //
translated: then there would be no consequence of confusion in the understanding of its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bos snang min la'ang //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos snang min la'ang //
translated: Even if it does not appear by its own nature,

original: gal te 'chol med yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te 'chol med yod na ni //
translated: if it exists without confusion,üîΩthen

original: mun par mthong ba dag la yang //
analyzed: mun par mthong ba dag la yang //
translated: Even in the case of seeing in the dark,

original: ma 'chol bar ni blta bar gyis //
analyzed: ma 'chol bar ni blta bar gyis //
translated: you see without any confusion.

original: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bya yin //üîΩtha dad par ni ma rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bya yin // tha dad par ni ma rtogs pa'i //
translated: The universal is made known by the particulars;üîΩthe particulars do not have the nature of making known the universal.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gsal byed min //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gsal byed min //
translated: If the universal is not apprehended as distinct,

original: des na tha snyad ci ltar 'gyur //üîΩji srid du rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i gsal ba rnams 'chol ba med pa ma yin pa de srid du spyi ma 'chol bar mi rtogs la /
analyzed: des na tha snyad ci ltar 'gyur // ji srid du rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i gsal ba rnams 'chol ba med pa ma yin pa de srid du spyi ma 'chol bar mi rtogs la /
translated: then how can there be a convention?üîΩAs long as the particulars of the same and different kinds are not unconfused, the universal is not apprehended as unconfused.

original: ji srid spyi 'chol ba med par ma rtogs pa de srid du yang gsal ba mi 'chol bar mi rtogs par phan tshun brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir spyi mi rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji srid spyi 'chol ba med par ma rtogs pa de srid du yang gsal ba mi 'chol bar mi rtogs par phan tshun brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir spyi mi rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: As long as the universal is not apprehended as unconfused, the particulars are not apprehended as unconfused. Thus, because of the fault of mutual dependence, the universal is not apprehended.

original: gal te khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i dper brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi mngon sum dang 'gal ba'i dper brjod ce na /
translated: If you say that the example is contradictory because it does not grasp the distinction,

original: sgra 'dis kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis mngon par bsams pa'i don nyid brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: sgra 'dis kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis mngon par bsams pa'i don nyid brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: then there is no fault, because the meaning that is intended is expressed by the word according to the speaker‚Äôs intention.

original: rjod par byed pa nyid kyis ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid kyis ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not described by the very one who describes?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: rnam kun brjod bya'i dngos min phyir //
analyzed: rnam kun brjod bya'i dngos min phyir //
translated: The universal is not the referent of any word.

original: grub pas de la brten phyir dang // de yi stobs kyis gnod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: grub pas de la brten phyir dang // de yi stobs kyis gnod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is established, because it is based on that, and because it is harmed by the power of that.

original: mnyan byas dbang po'i spyi yul bshad //
analyzed: mnyan byas dbang po'i spyi yul bshad //
translated: The universal of the sense faculty of hearing is said to be the object.

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgra yang rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgra yang rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: The sound that is the intrinsic identity of a word is not the referent of its intrinsic identity,

original: sgra thams cad ni spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgra spyi la 'jug byar lhag @192a * //
analyzed: sgra thams cad ni spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro // ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgra spyi la 'jug byar lhag @192a * //
translated: because all sounds have universals as their objects.

original: bar zhen pas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na nye bar mtshon par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: bar zhen pas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na nye bar mtshon par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you insist that the sound that is the intrinsic identity of a word is a superimposition that engages a universal, then it only refers to its intrinsic identity.

original: de lta na ni 'o na mnyan par bya ba'i sgra'i dbang pos gzung ba nyid nye bar mtshon pa rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na mnyan par bya ba'i sgra'i dbang pos gzung ba nyid nye bar mtshon pa rang bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: In that case, the intrinsic identity of the sound that is the object of apprehension by the sense faculty of hearing is referred to,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the intrinsic identity of the intrinsic identity.

original: dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba nyid las gzhan pa'i spyi yang grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba nyid las gzhan pa'i spyi yang grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And a universal that is different from being the object of apprehension by a sense faculty is not established.

original: tshad mar grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i dgos pa yang yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshad mar grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i dgos pa yang yod pa nyid de /
translated: There is also a purpose in teaching that it is established by valid knowledge.

original: tshad mas grub pas gnod par byed pa nyid de la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pas gnod par byed pa nyid de la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is established by valid knowledge, it is a refutation that is based on that.

original: gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a basis.

original: de'i stobs kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is harmed by the power of that.

original: tshad mas grub pa'i don ni de las gzhan tshad mas ma grub pa'i don gyi gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa'i don ni de las gzhan tshad mas ma grub pa'i don gyi gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: An object that is established by valid knowledge is a refutation of an object that is not established by valid knowledge.

original: de ni 'gal bar rtogs pa na gzhan med par rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'gal bar rtogs pa na gzhan med par rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: When one realizes that it is contradictory, one realizes that the other does not exist.

original: de med par rtogs par byed pa nyid gnod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de med par rtogs par byed pa nyid gnod pa yin gyi /
translated: Realizing that it does not exist is a refutation.

original: 'joms bya 'joms byed kyi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'joms bya 'joms byed kyi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of a destroyer and that which is to be destroyed.

original: des na 'di ni tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: des na 'di ni tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, this is not valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma 'dis ni sgra rang gi mtshan nyid grub pa yin no zhes yan lag dang bcas par bsgrub pa gsal bar bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma 'dis ni sgra rang gi mtshan nyid grub pa yin no zhes yan lag dang bcas par bsgrub pa gsal bar bstan pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of the statement is to show clearly that the proof of the existence of sound as a specific entity is complete.

original: rjes su dpag pas gsal ba yang bum ba rtag go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gsal ba yang bum ba rtag go zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: An example of an inference that is invalidated by perception is the statement, ‚ÄúThe pot is permanent.‚Äù

original: de kho na mtshon pa med pa'i grangs can dngos po yod pa nyid gsal bar mthong nas rtag par khas len pa de ni rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na mtshon pa med pa'i grangs can dngos po yod pa nyid gsal bar mthong nas rtag par khas len pa de ni rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya, who does not understand reality and who sees that an existent entity is clearly manifest, asserts that it is permanent. That assertion is invalidated by inference.

original: de lta yin na rgyu rnams kyi //
analyzed: de lta yin na rgyu rnams kyi //
translated: If that were so,

original: rtag tu nus pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu nus pa med par 'gyur //
translated: causes would always be without efficacy.

original: des na rgyu yi dngos po ni //
analyzed: des na rgyu yi dngos po ni //
translated: Therefore, since the state of being a cause

original: med pas tshor ba don med do //
analyzed: med pas tshor ba don med do //
translated: would not exist, feeling would be pointless.

original: rgyu med par gyur na mngon par 'dod pa tshol ba ni don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu med par gyur na mngon par 'dod pa tshol ba ni don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were causeless, it would be pointless to seek the desired object,

original: bya rgyu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya rgyu 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no purpose in doing so.

original: gsal ba byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it manifests the manifest,

original: gzhan pa yang don gyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan pa yang don gyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the nature of the object?

original: don rtag pa yin na gsal ba yang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtag pa yin na gsal ba yang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object is permanent, then the manifestation would also be permanent.

original: rtag tu gnas pa nyid yin pas bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa nyid yin pas bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Since it would always remain the same, it would not have the slightest activity.

original: 'on te gsal byed kyi tshig gi don ma yin na 'o na ni de'i dngos po las tha dad par 'gyur te 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te gsal byed kyi tshig gi don ma yin na 'o na ni de'i dngos po las tha dad par 'gyur te 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it is not the object of the word that manifests, then it would be different from the thing, because it would have a contradictory attribute.

original: tha dad pa med na ni dngos po yang 'bras bur thal lo //
analyzed: tha dad pa med na ni dngos po yang 'bras bur thal lo //
translated: If it is not different, then the thing would be the effect.

original: bum sogs 'jim gong la sogs la //
analyzed: bum sogs 'jim gong la sogs la //
translated: The pot and so on do not exist in the lump of clay and so on.

original: yod pa'i tshad ma yod ma yin //
analyzed: yod pa'i tshad ma yod ma yin //
translated: There is no valid cognition of their existence.

original: 'bras bu yin phyir de yod na //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin phyir de yod na //
translated: If they exist, then since they are effects,

original: 'bras bu yod na byar ci yod //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na byar ci yod //
translated: what is there to be done when the effect exists?

original: gsal ba yod nyid med par med //
analyzed: gsal ba yod nyid med par med //
translated: The manifestation does not exist without the existence of the manifest.

original: gsal ba med kyang yod par 'gyur //üîΩsgron sogs las bzhin thams cad la //
analyzed: gsal ba med kyang yod par 'gyur // sgron sogs las bzhin thams cad la //
translated: It would exist even without the manifestation.

original: gal te gsal @192b bar 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gal te gsal @192b bar 'dod na ni //
translated: If you assert that everything is manifest,üîΩlike a lamp and so on,

original: rdza mkhan sogs bzhin thams cad las //
analyzed: rdza mkhan sogs bzhin thams cad las //
translated: then like a potter and so on,

original: ci ste skyes par 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: ci ste skyes par 'dod ma yin //
translated: why is it not asserted that everything is produced?

original: 'jim gong stong phrag brgya dag tu //
analyzed: 'jim gong stong phrag brgya dag tu //
translated: Even in a hundred thousand lumps of clay,

original: lcigs kyang de ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: lcigs kyang de ni mthong ba med //
translated: But that is not seen.

original: mthong med der ni der yod na //
analyzed: mthong med der ni der yod na //
translated: If it exists there, where it is not seen,

original: bong bu'i rva yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: then the horns of an ass would exist there.

original: phyis de mthong ba med ce na //
analyzed: phyis de mthong ba med ce na //
translated: If it is said that it is not seen later,

original: phyis mthong de tshe yod par 'gyur ;
analyzed: phyis mthong de tshe yod par 'gyur ;
translated: then at the time it is seen, it would exist.

original: / gal te bum pa phyi nas dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: / gal te bum pa phyi nas dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If it is said that the pot is perceived later,

original: gsal ba bzhin phyis ni yod pa yin mod sngar ci ltar yod /
analyzed: gsal ba bzhin phyis ni yod pa yin mod sngar ci ltar yod /
translated: then it is certainly existent later, just as it was before.

original: gzhan du gsal ba blo mi 'byung ba'i phyir spyi nyid dang por rtogs so /üîΩzhe na / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du gsal ba blo mi 'byung ba'i phyir spyi nyid dang por rtogs so / zhe na / de ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so, because the cognition of the particular does not occur first.

original: spyi yang res 'ga' yang khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: spyi yang res 'ga' yang khyad par can du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: But that is not so, because sometimes the universal becomes the particular,

original: phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the related entities of the particular and the universal.üîΩIf the universal always exists, then why is it not cognized in the particular that is doubted?

original: dus thams cad du spyi srid pa nyid yin na gsal ba the tshom za ba la yang ci ste mi rtogs gang zhig rnam par gcod par byed pa de ni khyad par yin la /
analyzed: dus thams cad du spyi srid pa nyid yin na gsal ba the tshom za ba la yang ci ste mi rtogs gang zhig rnam par gcod par byed pa de ni khyad par yin la /
translated: That which is the distinguisher is the particular.

original: rnam par gcod par byed pa yang the tshom bzlog par nus pa gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod par byed pa yang the tshom bzlog par nus pa gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: And the exclusion is that which is able to eliminate doubt.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gang gi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang gi ngo bo yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the existence of its nature,

original: don gyi bdag nyid ldog pa min //
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid ldog pa min //
translated: The nature of the object is not excluded.

original: rang bzhin yod pa min pa ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa min pa ni //
translated: That which does not exist by nature

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis ldog pa yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis ldog pa yin //
translated: Is excluded by its very nature.

original: khyad par stong phrag yod kyang ni //
analyzed: khyad par stong phrag yod kyang ni //
translated: Even though there are thousands of distinctions,

original: snga ma ldog par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: snga ma ldog par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: The former is not excluded.

original: gsal ba bzlog phyir de las ni //
analyzed: gsal ba bzlog phyir de las ni //
translated: Because the manifestation is excluded,

original: spyi nges par ni 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: spyi nges par ni 'gyur ba yin //
translated: The universal is ascertained from it.

original: 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa'i nges pa ni rang bzhin nges par gzung ba nyid las 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa'i nges pa ni rang bzhin nges par gzung ba nyid las 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù operates by the apprehension of the nature of the individual.

original: spyi ni mtshungs pa nyid yin la //
analyzed: spyi ni mtshungs pa nyid yin la //
translated: The universal is sameness,

original: gsal ba rnams kyang dbyibs dang ni //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams kyang dbyibs dang ni //
translated: And the manifestations are the same by shape

original: nus pa'i dbye bas mtshungs pa nyid //
analyzed: nus pa'i dbye bas mtshungs pa nyid //
translated: And by the division of capacity.

original: des na rigs ni don med nyid //
analyzed: des na rigs ni don med nyid //
translated: Therefore the universal is meaningless.

original: gal te lkog thal la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang 'gal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa'i phyir nges pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: gal te lkog thal la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang 'gal ba la sogs pa'i nus pa'i phyir nges pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: If the shape of the cow‚Äôs body and so on and the capacity of the cow‚Äôs body and so on to perform such functions as carrying on its back are the cause of ascertainment, then the universal is not tenable.

original: de nyid spyi yin no //
analyzed: de nyid spyi yin no //
translated: That is the universal.

original: de yang gsal ba dag las tha mi dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gsal ba dag las tha mi dad pa nyid do //
translated: And that is not different from the particulars.

original: nang na tha dad pa yod na ji ltar spyi yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nang na tha dad pa yod na ji ltar spyi yin no zhe na /
translated: If there is difference within the universal, how can it be a universal?

original: spyi smra ba la ci ltar gsal ba yin /
analyzed: spyi smra ba la ci ltar gsal ba yin /
translated: How can the universal be a particular?

original: mi 'dra ba nyid kyis so zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba nyid kyis so zhe na /
translated: Because of its difference.

original: rta dang ba lang la sogs pa la ci ste ma yin te de dag la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rta dang ba lang la sogs pa la ci ste ma yin te de dag la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so in the case of a horse and a cow, etc.? Because they are not capable of it.

original: 'di dag phan tshun mi 'dra ba nyid yin na ci ltar nus pa yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun mi 'dra ba nyid yin na ci ltar nus pa yod pa yin /
translated: If they are different from each other, how can they be capable of it?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs so zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs so zhe na /
translated: The nature of things is the answer.

original: rkang ba brkyang pa tsam ni 'di'i skyabs ma yin te /
analyzed: rkang ba brkyang pa tsam ni 'di'i skyabs ma yin te /
translated: The mere stretching of the legs is not the answer.

original: de lta ma yin na spyi med pa kho nar kha dog dang dbyibs tsam gyis ma 'chol ba'i tha snyad 'grub pa'i phyir spyi med na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na spyi med pa kho nar kha dog dang dbyibs tsam gyis ma 'chol ba'i tha snyad 'grub pa'i phyir spyi med na /
translated: Otherwise, if there were no universal, the mere color and shape would be established as the unmixed convention, and if there were no universal,

original: @193a * // ci ltar zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: @193a * // ci ltar zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: why would it be said ‚Äúhow‚Äù?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lan bya rog gis ma zos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lan bya rog gis ma zos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The crow has not eaten the reply, namely, ‚ÄúThe nature of things themselves are the reply.‚Äù

original: lkog shal la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni 'chol ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni 'chol ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The shape of the neck, etc., is not a jumble,

original: gzhan la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not seen elsewhere.

original: bram ze la sogs pa gang la dbyibs la sogs pa 'chol ba yod pa der ni /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa gang la dbyibs la sogs pa 'chol ba yod pa der ni /
translated: In the case of a brahmin, etc., where the shape, etc., is a jumble,

original: sgre bo'i brda tsam zhig skyabs yin te /
analyzed: sgre bo'i brda tsam zhig skyabs yin te /
translated: the mere sign of a hump is the refuge.

original: chang mi 'thung ba la sogs pas kun du spyod pa bzang ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: chang mi 'thung ba la sogs pas kun du spyod pa bzang ba tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just a good practice not to drink alcohol, etc.

original: de'i phyir ring du song yang de las gzhan la ldog pa nyid /
analyzed: de'i phyir ring du song yang de las gzhan la ldog pa nyid /
translated: Therefore, even if one goes far, one will return to that.

original: spyi rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin pas gzhan ni don med do //üîΩgzhan yang / bram ze gsod dang sbyin sogs la //
analyzed: spyi rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin pas gzhan ni don med do // gzhan yang / bram ze gsod dang sbyin sogs la //
translated: Since the cause of the classification of universals is just that, and not anything else, anything else is meaningless.üîΩMoreover,üîΩThe presentation of sin and merit

original: sdig dang bsod nams rnam gzhag pa //üîΩbstan bcos nyid las de yi phyir //
analyzed: sdig dang bsod nams rnam gzhag pa // bstan bcos nyid las de yi phyir //
translated: In the case of killing a brahmin, giving, etc.,üîΩIs just in the treatises.

original: tshad ma dpyad pa don med yin //
analyzed: tshad ma dpyad pa don med yin //
translated: Therefore, the analysis of valid cognition is meaningless.

original: zhes 'di ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: zhes 'di ni bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: des na sdig pa dang bsod nam skyed par byed pa nyid la sogs pa spyi'i chos rnams ni spong yang spong ba la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sdig pa dang bsod nam skyed par byed pa nyid la sogs pa spyi'i chos rnams ni spong yang spong ba la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in general, the properties of producing sin and merit and so on are not harmed by the abandonment of the object of abandonment.

original: 'dis mnyan bya'i sgras bstan pa yin te de dag dbang po'i shes pa la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis mnyan bya'i sgras bstan pa yin te de dag dbang po'i shes pa la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This also teaches that they are not indicated by the word ‚Äúheard,‚Äù because they do not appear to the sense consciousnesses.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba yang bstan pa yin no //üîΩgal te rang bzhin des gnod na skyon yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bstan par bya ba ma yin na sgra rang gi mtshan nyid med de zhes bya ba 'di nyid ci ste mi brjod de la phan pa'i mtha' can 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba yang bstan pa yin no // gal te rang bzhin des gnod na skyon yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bstan par bya ba ma yin na sgra rang gi mtshan nyid med de zhes bya ba 'di nyid ci ste mi brjod de la phan pa'i mtha' can 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sgra
translated: It also teaches that they are not harmed by inference.üîΩIf they are harmed by that nature, it is a fault.üîΩIf this is not to be taught, why not state this alone: ‚ÄúSound does not have its own characteristic‚Äù?üîΩWhat is the use of stating the word ‚Äúonly,‚Äù which has the purpose of connecting it to the end of the benefit of that?

original: brjod pas ci zhig bya de ltar brjod na ni 'dir 'brel pa bzlog pa nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod pas ci zhig bya de ltar brjod na ni 'dir 'brel pa bzlog pa nyid du 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is stated in that way, then it would be asserted that the connection here is reversed.

original: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Moreover, that is to be understood from the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: de ci ltar 'di mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar 'di mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Why is this not tenable?

original: 'di skyon gzhan yin la rag mod /
analyzed: 'di skyon gzhan yin la rag mod /
translated: This is another fault.

original: ma dmigs bzhin du yod mod zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: ma dmigs bzhin du yod mod zhes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: But you cannot say that something exists when it is not observed.

original: gal te ma dmigs pa ni dmigs pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs pa ni dmigs pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that non-observation is not non-existence,

original: des na dmigs pa nyid med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa nyid med pa yin gyi /
translated: then it is the non-existence of observation itself,

original: don med par ni ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don med par ni ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could it be the non-existence of the object?

original: gal te de lta na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang med pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang med pa mi 'grub po //
translated: If that is so, then the non-existence of the horn of a rabbit, etc. is not established.

original: des na med pa ni rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na med pa ni rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gtan tshigs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause it is without a cause‚Äù is not established.

original: des na ri bong gi rva don du gnyer bar len par len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ri bong gi rva don du gnyer bar len par len par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who seeks the horn of a rabbit would take up its acquisition.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de de la yod des na 'di //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de de la yod des na 'di //
translated: It exists in that, therefore this

original: de rgyu nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: is taken to be its cause.

original: de skyed med par @193b 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: de skyed med par @193b 'gyur ba ni //
translated: If it is not produced,

original: de med des na med 'dod na //
analyzed: de med des na med 'dod na //
translated: it is not, therefore, non-existence is accepted.

original: des bskyed pa yi nus pa nyid //
analyzed: des bskyed pa yi nus pa nyid //
translated: The capacity to produce it

original: yod pa nyid phyir rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: yod pa nyid phyir rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: exists, therefore, it is understood.

original: de lta min na da rtogs pas //
analyzed: de lta min na da rtogs pas //
translated: If it were not so, it would be understood now.

original: de yod pas ni rtogs mi 'gyur //üîΩ'on te gang las gang skyes pa //
analyzed: de yod pas ni rtogs mi 'gyur // 'on te gang las gang skyes pa //
translated: But if it exists, it is not to be cognized.üîΩIf it is cognized as existing

original: de la de yod par rtogs na //üîΩskyes pa'i sngon rol shes med pa //
analyzed: de la de yod par rtogs na // skyes pa'i sngon rol shes med pa //
translated: In that from which it has arisen,üîΩHow can it be cognized as not being

original: de las de min ci ltar rtogs //
analyzed: de las de min ci ltar rtogs //
translated: That which existed prior to its arising?üîΩIn this way, arising is not established

original: de lta skye ba yod pa dang // 'brel pa rab tu 'grub pa ma yin //
analyzed: de lta skye ba yod pa dang // 'brel pa rab tu 'grub pa ma yin //
translated: As being related to existence.

original: ci ltar rgyu las 'bras yin pa //
analyzed: ci ltar rgyu las 'bras yin pa //
translated: How can an effect be a cause?

original: de yod las kyang de 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: de yod las kyang de 'byung 'gyur //
translated: The effect exists, and it arises from the cause.

original: 'bras gang gang zhig sngon 'gro can //
analyzed: 'bras gang gang zhig sngon 'gro can //
translated: Whatever effect is preceded by a cause

original: de ni de'i zhes gnas phyir ro //üîΩde yod sngon 'gro can 'bras bu //
analyzed: de ni de'i zhes gnas phyir ro // de yod sngon 'gro can 'bras bu //
translated: Is said to be of that nature.üîΩHow can the effect that exists prior to the cause

original: de de nyid kyis ci ltar 'gyur//
analyzed: de de nyid kyis ci ltar 'gyur//
translated: Be of the nature of the cause?

original: gzhan bzhin 'bras bu thams cad ni //
analyzed: gzhan bzhin 'bras bu thams cad ni //
translated: If you say that all effects

original: nus las 'byung ba'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: nus las 'byung ba'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Arise from potential,

original: nus pa nyid las nus 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: nus pa nyid las nus 'byung 'gyur //
translated: Then the effect would arise from potential,

original: tha dad med na ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: tha dad med na ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: But if they are not different, how could they arise?

original: gal te nus las gsal skye na //
analyzed: gal te nus las gsal skye na //
translated: If the effect arises from potential,

original: nus la gsal ba gzhan nas ci //
analyzed: nus la gsal ba gzhan nas ci //
translated: How is the effect different from the potential?

original: gzhan nam med pas bskyed bya min //
analyzed: gzhan nam med pas bskyed bya min //
translated: If it is different, it is not produced;

original: gal te yod na ci ltar bskyed //
analyzed: gal te yod na ci ltar bskyed //

original: gsal ba blo yin de yang yod //
analyzed: gsal ba blo yin de yang yod //

original: des na de ni bskyed bya min //
analyzed: des na de ni bskyed bya min //

original: 'on te gsal ba myong yin na //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba myong yin na //
translated: But if the clear is the experience,

original: bskyed bya min de ci ltar skye //üîΩdes na 'bras bu rang gis ni //
analyzed: bskyed bya min de ci ltar skye // des na 'bras bu rang gis ni //
translated: How is it produced, not being produced?üîΩTherefore, the effect is not clear

original: bskyed pa pos gsal tshad ldan min //
analyzed: bskyed pa pos gsal tshad ldan min //
translated: To the extent that it is produced.

original: bum pa mun nang gnas pa la //
analyzed: bum pa mun nang gnas pa la //
translated: In the case of a pot in the dark,

original: rig pa'i tshad ma rjes dpag yod //
analyzed: rig pa'i tshad ma rjes dpag yod //
translated: There is inference, a valid cognition.

original: bum sogs 'jim gong la sogs la //
analyzed: bum sogs 'jim gong la sogs la //
translated: In the case of a pot and so on,

original: yod la rig pa'i tshad ma med //
analyzed: yod la rig pa'i tshad ma med //
translated: There is existence but not a valid cognition.

original: des na thams cad gsal ba bzhin //
analyzed: des na thams cad gsal ba bzhin //
translated: Therefore, all things are like the clear,

original: byas pa'i phyir na mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir na mi rtag nyid //
translated: Because they are produced, they are impermanent.

original: des na rtags nyid phyogs su ni //
analyzed: des na rtags nyid phyogs su ni //
translated: Therefore, the reason itself is

original: byas te rjes dpag ces byas gnod //
analyzed: byas te rjes dpag ces byas gnod //
translated: The produced, called inference.

original: 'o na mngon sum gyi don dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ces pa dang grags pas rang gi chos can la ma bsal ba zhes rang gi chos can smos pa la don ci yod /üîΩ'di ltar / tshad mas gnod pa phyogs min zhes //
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum gyi don dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ces pa dang grags pas rang gi chos can la ma bsal ba zhes rang gi chos can smos pa la don ci yod / 'di ltar / tshad mas gnod pa phyogs min zhes //
translated: Well, what is the meaning of direct perception, inference, and what is said to be well known, and what is the meaning of stating the subject when it is not eliminated in one's own system?üîΩIn this way,üîΩThis assertion is reasonable:

original: 'dod pa 'di ni rigs pa yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'di ni rigs pa yin //

analyzed: chos can de 'am gzhan dag la // bya ba 'di ni gang la dgos //

original: chos can gzhan la gnod pa ni //
analyzed: chos can gzhan la gnod pa ni //

original: gnod pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: cannot be a refutation of that .

original: rnam pa thams cad du gnod pa ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi yul med pas phyogs ma yin no zhes rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gnod pa ni bsgrub par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi yul med pas phyogs ma yin no zhes rigs so zhe na /
translated: It is not logical to say that the subject is not the object of the argument because it is impossible to refute it in every way.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: kun tu rgol ba bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: kun tu rgol ba bdag nyid kyi //
translated: The opponent himself

analyzed: bsgrub byar 'dod pa'i chos gang yin // chos de ldan la gnod 'gyur gyi //
translated: wishes to prove that the subjectüîΩhas a property.üîΩIf that property is refuted,

original: chos gzhan gyi ni chos gzhan min //üîΩ@194a * // thams cad du rang dang gzhan gyi 'dod pas chos de chos can la yod pa nyid yin pa /
analyzed: chos gzhan gyi ni chos gzhan min // @194a * // thams cad du rang dang gzhan gyi 'dod pas chos de chos can la yod pa nyid yin pa /

translated: If the subject that has the property that the opponent himself wishes to prove is refuted, then the fault of refuting the subject arises.

analyzed: chos gzhan gyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can la ni ma yin no zhes rang gi chos can smos so // gzhan du chos can gzhan la ni // gnod kyang 'di la ci zhig dgag /'di la rigs pa ni 'di yin te //
translated: and not some other subject.

analyzed: chos de dang ldan pa'i chos can nyid la gnod na gnod pa yin gyi /

analyzed: chos gzhan dang ldan pa gnod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But if some other subject is undermined, then the negation is not established.üîΩThe point is that even though the subject is understood by means of its definition,

analyzed: don 'di mtshan nyid kyis rtogs kyang //
translated: the subject is mentioned in order to showüîΩthat the negation is established by undermining the subject itself,üîΩand not by undermining some other subject.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.

original: rang gi chos can smos pa ni //üîΩchos can la ni gnod pas kyang //
analyzed: rang gi chos can smos pa ni // chos can la ni gnod pas kyang //
translated: The point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,

analyzed: gnod 'gyur zhes ni grub don te // rten ni 'gal bar gyur pa yis //
translated: because the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,

original: der brten pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: der brten pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: because the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nar bstan par bya ba dang rang nyid 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kho na las 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nar bstan par bya ba dang rang nyid 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kho na las 'grub pa yin te /
translated: The point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.

original: rgol bas rang lta'i rnam can chos //
analyzed: rgol bas rang lta'i rnam can chos //
translated: The point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,

original: bsgrub bya yin zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub bya yin zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: because the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis of the property-possessor itself,üîΩbecause the basis is undermined.üîΩThe point is that the negation is established by undermining the very basis

original: no // de lta yin dang de dang rjes su mthun pa la gnod pas de nyid kyi skyon du thal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: no // de lta yin dang de dang rjes su mthun pa la gnod pas de nyid kyi skyon du thal ba yin gyi /
translated: If that were so, then since the reason would be contradictory to that, the fault would follow from that alone,

original: gzhan du srid pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du srid pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and it would not be possible in any other way.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: rten 'gal ba'i sgo nas de'i chos kyang med par thal ba'i phyir chos can la gnod na yang gnod par ji ltar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: rten 'gal ba'i sgo nas de'i chos kyang med par thal ba'i phyir chos can la gnod na yang gnod par ji ltar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i don to //
translated: because it is taught that if the subject is undermined, then the reason is also undermined, because it follows that the property of that subject would not exist due to the contradiction of the basis.

original: gzhan du de lta'i rnam can chos //
analyzed: gzhan du de lta'i rnam can chos //
translated: The property that has that aspect

analyzed: bsgrub bya yin zhes brjod pa'i phyir // de gnod nyid yin par sems la //
translated: is said to be the probandum.

original: des na rang gi chos can smos //
analyzed: des na rang gi chos can smos //
translated: Therefore, the subject is statedüîΩbecause it is thought that the reason is undermined.
